result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: 10 mg of the sample was dispersed into 1 mL ultrapure waterethanol (1:1), and then 20L of a 0.5 Nafion ethanol solution was added into above turbid liquid followed by sonication for 30 min.30 Lof the resultant solution was then added dropwise onto 0.7 cm 0.7 cm conductive ITO glass, and dried 28. Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction was performed using an off-line Labsolar-AG closed gas circulation system (350 mL; Beijing Perfect light Technology Co., Ltd China).A 300 W high-pressure xenon lamp was used to

xenon lamp was used to irradiate the reaction cell (Pyrex glass) containing 5 mL of distilled water and 50 mg of the photocatalyst which was uniformly dispersed on a 28.26 cm 2 glass sheet.The glass with the photocatalyst was installed above the water instead of submerged into water and the reactor was carefully sealed with vacuum grease.Prior to irradiation, the above system was evacuated with Ar for 5 min to completely remove any air inside the reactor. 1 mL of CO 2 gas was then injected into the

photocatalytic reaction, the solution after irradiation was analysed by GC-MS.The GC MS traces are shown in Fig. S5 (a) and (b), the mz signals at 17 and 29 correspond to 13 CO and 13 CH 4 , respectively.Furthermore, the intensities of the signals corresponding to 13 CH 4 and 13 CO increased with increased irradiation times, which indicate that CO and CH 4 were formed in the photocatalytic reaction. Mesoporous structures possess abundant absorption sites for CO 2 molecules.As shown in Fig. 6, when MCT is

Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reactions (CO 2 RRs) are of significant interest for its application prospects in energy field and CO 2 removal in air.Herein we report mesoporous g-C 3 N 4 Ti 3 C 2 T x (MCT) as a highly active photocatalyst in CO 2 reduction reactions.We have found that mesoporous structures are compatible with high speed electronic transmission systems and demonstrate that MCT enables the excellent separation of electrons and holes.Mesoporous g-C 3 N 4 Ti 3 C 2 T x (MCT) shows a production

of 417 nm (MC) or 429 nm (MCT).The Brunauere Emmette Teller (BET) surface areas of the materials were measured using a Autosorb (IQ) instrument at 77.3 K.The pore size distributions were obtained using the Barrett Joyner-Halenda (BJH) method. EIS and photocurrents were obtained on a CHI 1030B electrochemical workstation in a three-electrode cell filled with 0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 , in which the AgAgCl electrode and Pt wire were used as the reference and counter electrodes, respectively.Typically, 10 mg of the

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

instrument).X-ray photoelectron spectra (XPS) were recorded on a Thermo Scientific ESCALAB 250Xi Xray photoelectron spectrometer with a pass energy of 20.00 eV and an Al K excitation source (1486.6 eV).UV-Vis diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) were recorded on a HITACHI UH-4150 instrument with BaSO 4 as a reference.Photoluminescence (PL) spectra and time-resolved fluorescence decay spectra were recorded at room temperature on a FLS 980 instrument with an excitation wavelength of 417 nm (MC) or 429 nm
